intro: Pelexia cranichoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved twayblade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in a spike. It is characterized by its lack of true leaves and its ability to photosynthesize through its stems. Pelexia cranichoides is native to North America and is often found in the eastern United States.
